intro: Monnina cladostachya, commonly known as prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and prairies. It has small, oval leaves and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Monnina cladostachya is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and thrive in harsh conditions.
